citations.narrative:
Some primary enclosures for nonhuman primates are not kept in good repair:
**There is an approximately 6-inch by 1-inch break in the wall surface of enclosure AA232B, exposing a rusted metal
panel beneath. The enclosure is part of a concrete cast sheltered housing facility. This enclosure houses 10 pig-tailed
macaques. The facility submitted a work order during the inspection to address the defect. Nonhuman primate primary
enclosures that are not in good repair may not protect them from injury, nor allow for proper cleaning and sanitization.
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials and must be kept in good repair.
Correct by 27 June 2025.
**A majority of the quadrant style primary enclosures in an indoor facility have at least 1 vertical sliding pulley system door
with moderate damage due to use and animal activity. The doors have been retrofitted with a metal footer to restore a flat
edge, but roughened surfaces remain exposed. Nonhuman primate primary enclosures that are not in good repair may
not allow for proper cleaning and sanitization.
Correct by 31 December 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.80(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Some primary enclosures for nonhuman primates are not kept in good repair: 
 
**There is an approximately 6-inch by 1-inch break in the wall surface of enclosure AA232B, exposing a rusted metal 
panel beneath. The enclosure is part of a concrete cast sheltered housing facility. This enclosure houses 10 pig-tailed 
macaques. The facility submitted a work order during the inspection to address the defect. Nonhuman primate primary 
enclosures that are not in good repair may not protect them from injury, nor allow for proper cleaning and sanitization. 
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials and must be kept in good repair. 
Correct by 27 June 2025. 
 
**A majority of the quadrant style primary enclosures in an indoor facility have at least 1 vertical sliding pulley system door 
with moderate damage due to use and animal activity. The doors have been retrofitted with a metal footer to restore a flat 
edge, but roughened surfaces remain exposed. Nonhuman primate primary enclosures that are not in good repair may 
not allow for proper cleaning and sanitization.  
 
Correct by 31 December 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
